name: 蕭榮修
objective: This course introduces students to probability and random variables. Topics include fundamental probability theory, random variables, distribution functions, Bernoulli, binomial, negative binomial, geometric, hypergeometric, and Poisson distributions. The other continuous topics covered are uniform, exponential, normal, gamma and beta distributions; joint distributions; properties of expectation, central limit theorem, Chebyshev inequality, and law of large numbers.
schedule:
1. Introduction and Review of Set Theory
2. Combinatorial Analysis
3. Axioms of Probability
4. Conditional Probability and Independence
5. Random Variables, Expected Value, and Variance
6. Discrete Random Variables - I
7. Discrete Random Variables - II
8. Discrete Random Variables - III
9. Mid-term Exam
10. Continuous Random Variables -I
11. Continuous Random Variables -II
12. Jointly Distributed Random Variables - I
13. Jointly Distributed Random Variables - II
14. Properties of Expectation - I
15. Properties of Expectation - II
16. Limit Theorems - I
17. Limit Theorems - II
18. Final Exam
